text:
Went to Starbucks for lunch after my MRI procedure. The (male) Indian staff who attended to me is really kind, he kindly send the drink to me (instead of calling out my name) I believe he noticed the plaster on my hand.

During my meal I noticed a staff delivered the food direct to the table for lady with walking aids.

I want to shout out to the staff in Gleneagles Starbucks demonstrating great empathy for customers and go above standard process to serve their customers

Very bad service and Slow service. really messy. coffee tastes weird.
To for my food and coffee almost 25 minutes. and the queue after me already got their drink üëéüèªüëéüèº

At Gleneagles Hospital Starbucks during lunch. Excellent staff, very jovial and friendly, addressing customer by the name once membership card is scanned. Great meatless beef, avocado and mushroom cheese wrap. Love the food, thank you for the great service!

Staff was really kind to help me with my mobile order (in order to use the 50% discount) and also heated up my chicken pie even though I didn't ask for it (it was for a take away). Super nice gesture and thanks for the fast service too!

Value breakfast set for $7.90. Tables were clean.

Better if my order is called when the whole set is ready.

By 830am the approximate 10 seatings here are close to fully occupied.

Aircon today is pretty chilly, probably due to morning rain too.

Personally, the ingredients for the Turkey ham Pita is somewhat salty.

Had a fly landed on the rim of my cup ü§®
